**Karen Gillan** (born 28 November 1987[1]) is a Scottish actress, director,
screenwriter and model. She played the role of [Amy Pond](/wiki/Amy_Pond "Amy
Pond"), [companion](/wiki/Companion_\(Doctor_Who\) "Companion \(Doctor Who\)")
to the [Eleventh Doctor](/wiki/Eleventh_Doctor "Eleventh Doctor"), in the [BBC
One](/wiki/BBC_One "BBC One") science fiction series _[Doctor
Who](/wiki/Doctor_Who "Doctor Who")_ (2010–2013). She has received wide
recognition for portraying [Nebula](/wiki/Nebula_\(comics\) "Nebula
\(comics\)") in the [Marvel Cinematic
Universe](/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe "Marvel Cinematic Universe") films
_[Guardians of the Galaxy](/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_\(film\) "Guardians
of the Galaxy \(film\)")_ (2014), _[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol.
2](/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_Vol._2 "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2")_
(2017), _[Avengers: Infinity War](/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War "Avengers:
Infinity War")_ (2018), and [its untitled sequel](/wiki/Untitled_Avengers_film
"Untitled Avengers film") (2019), and also played Ruby Roundhouse in the box-
office hit _[Jumanji: Welcome to the
Jungle](/wiki/Jumanji:_Welcome_to_the_Jungle "Jumanji: Welcome to the
Jungle")_ (2017).

In 2018, she released her first feature film as writer and director, titled
_[The Party's Just Beginning](/wiki/The_Party%27s_Just_Beginning "The Party's
Just Beginning")_.[2]

## Early
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Karen_Gillan&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life")]

Gillan was born and raised in [Inverness](/wiki/Inverness "Inverness") in the
[Scottish Highlands](/wiki/Scottish_Highlands "Scottish Highlands"), the only
child of Marie (née Paterson) and Raymond Gillan, a singer and recording
artist.[3] When she turned 16, Gillan moved to [Edinburgh](/wiki/Edinburgh
"Edinburgh") and completed an HNC Acting and Performance course at [Telford
College](/wiki/Telford_College "Telford College").[4] She moved to
[London](/wiki/London "London") at age 18 to study at the [drama
school](/wiki/Drama_school "Drama school"), [Italia Conti Academy of Theatre
Arts](/wiki/Italia_Conti_Academy_of_Theatre_Arts "Italia Conti Academy of
Theatre Arts").[5][6]

While studying at Italia Conti, Gillan was scouted by a modelling agency.[7]
Gillan has said she would not give up her acting career to return to
modelling, stating that she enjoyed modelling but acting was always her main
interest and goal.[8]

##
Career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Karen_Gillan&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Career")]

###
Television[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Karen_Gillan&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Television")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/72/The_Eleventh_Doctor_and_Amy_Pond.jpg/220px-
The_Eleventh_Doctor_and_Amy_Pond.jpg)](/wiki/File:The_Eleventh_Doctor_and_Amy_Pond.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:The_Eleventh_Doctor_and_Amy_Pond.jpg "Enlarge")

Gillan with [Matt Smith](/wiki/Matt_Smith_\(actor\) "Matt Smith \(actor\)"),
filming her first [Doctor Who](/wiki/Doctor_Who "Doctor Who")
[episode](/wiki/The_Eleventh_Hour_\(Doctor_Who\) "The Eleventh Hour \(Doctor
Who\)") as [Amy Pond](/wiki/Amy_Pond "Amy Pond").

Gillan's early television acting career included guest appearances on several
drama series, with her first role being in an episode of
_[Rebus](/wiki/Rebus_\(TV_series\) "Rebus \(TV series\)")_ , a role she
obtained while still at Italia Conti.[9] Gillan then undertook a two-year
stint as a member of the ensemble cast of the [sketch
comedy](/wiki/Sketch_comedy "Sketch comedy") series _[The Kevin Bishop
Show](/wiki/The_Kevin_Bishop_Show "The Kevin Bishop Show")_ , in which she
played multiple characters including celebrities such as [Katy
Perry](/wiki/Katy_Perry "Katy Perry") and [Angelina
Jolie](/wiki/Angelina_Jolie "Angelina Jolie"). Gillan also appeared on TV in a
leading role in a horror project entitled _The Well_ , which was broadcast as
a series of episodic short films on [BBC Two](/wiki/BBC_Two "BBC Two") and
later as a web series on BBC.co.uk. Part of the BBC's multimedia "switch"
programming, the short episodes interconnect with online games that further
explore the environments presented in the series.[10]

She was cast for the role of the [Eleventh Doctor](/wiki/Eleventh_Doctor
"Eleventh Doctor")'s first companion, Amy Pond, on the British sci-fi series
_Doctor Who_ in May 2009. She made her first on-screen appearance as Amy Pond
in "[The Eleventh Hour](/wiki/The_Eleventh_Hour_\(Doctor_Who\) "The Eleventh
Hour \(Doctor Who\)")" with her cousin Caitlin Blackwood portraying a young
Amelia (Amy) Pond.[11][12][13] In 2010, she won in the Entertainment category
at [Young Scot Awards](/wiki/Young_Scot_Awards "Young Scot Awards"), which she
accepted via video link as she was filming abroad and unable to attend the
ceremony.[14] She appeared in the following [sixth
series](/wiki/Doctor_Who_\(series_6\) "Doctor Who \(series 6\)") in 2011 and
the first five episodes of the [seventh series](/wiki/Doctor_Who_\(series_7\)
"Doctor Who \(series 7\)") in 2012. She reprised the role in a cameo
appearance in the 2013 Christmas special "[The Time of the
Doctor](/wiki/The_Time_of_the_Doctor "The Time of the Doctor")". Gillan had
appeared in _Doctor Who_ once before in the [series
four](/wiki/Doctor_Who_\(series_4\) "Doctor Who \(series 4\)") episode "[The
Fires of Pompeii](/wiki/The_Fires_of_Pompeii "The Fires of Pompeii")" in the
role of a Soothsayer.[7]

During an interview at the 2011 [San Diego Comic-Con](/wiki/San_Diego_Comic-
Con_International "San Diego Comic-Con International"), Gillan revealed that
she would be returning to _Doctor Who_ for its seventh series.[15] On 15
December 2011, it was announced Gillan and [Arthur
Darvill](/wiki/Arthur_Darvill "Arthur Darvill") ([Rory
Williams](/wiki/Rory_Williams "Rory Williams")) would be leaving _Doctor Who_
during the seventh series in 2012.[16]

She was cast in comedian Charlie Brooker's TV series _A Touch of Cloth_ ,[17]
portraying Kerry Newblood. Gillan joined the regular cast of [Adult
Swim](/wiki/Adult_Swim "Adult Swim")'s _[NTSF:SD:SUV::](/wiki/NTSF:SD:SUV::
"NTSF:SD:SUV::")_ for the show's third season in 2013.[18][19]

In February 2014, Gillan was cast as the lead in
_[Selfie](/wiki/Selfie_\(TV_series\) "Selfie \(TV series\)")_ , an American
single-camera sitcom for [ABC](/wiki/American_Broadcasting_Company "American
Broadcasting Company"), which is produced by [Warner Bros.
Television](/wiki/Warner_Bros._Television "Warner Bros. Television") and was
greenlit for the 2014–15 US television season. Gillan played a social media-
obsessed socialite named Eliza Dooley, a modern-day take on the main character
from _[My Fair Lady](/wiki/My_Fair_Lady "My Fair Lady")_ , [Eliza
Doolittle](/wiki/Eliza_Doolittle "Eliza Doolittle"). This was Gillan's first
time starring in the lead role of an American television series.[20][21][22]
The series was cancelled by ABC on 7 November 2014 after seven episodes;[23]
the remaining six episodes were made available on [Hulu](/wiki/Hulu "Hulu")
starting 25 November 2014.[24]

###
Film[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Karen_Gillan&action=edit&section=4&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Film")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8e/Karen_Gillan_by_Gage_Skidmore_3.jpg/170px-
Karen_Gillan_by_Gage_Skidmore_3.jpg)](/wiki/File:Karen_Gillan_by_Gage_Skidmore_3.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Karen_Gillan_by_Gage_Skidmore_3.jpg "Enlarge")

Gillan at the 2016 [San Diego Comic-Con](/wiki/San_Diego_Comic-Con "San Diego
Comic-Con")

She appeared in the [Channel 4](/wiki/Channel_4 "Channel 4") film
_[Stacked](/wiki/Stacked_\(film\) "Stacked \(film\)")_ , playing the role of
Ginny.[25]

In August 2011, it was announced that Gillan would star in an indie Scottish
[romantic comedy](/wiki/Romantic_comedy "Romantic comedy") called _[Not
Another Happy Ending](/wiki/Not_Another_Happy_Ending "Not Another Happy
Ending")_ alongside [Emun Elliott](/wiki/Emun_Elliott "Emun Elliott").[26] She
was selected by director [John McKay](/wiki/John_McKay_\(director\) "John
McKay \(director\)") because he came to know her during the production of
_[We'll Take Manhattan](/wiki/We%27ll_Take_Manhattan_\(2012_film\) "We'll Take
Manhattan \(2012 film\)")_, which he also directed, as "a very bubbly,
vibrant, energetic, funny, slightly clumsy person" who was a perfect fit for
the character.[27] Filming took place in July 2012,[26] though Elliott was
replaced by [Stanley Weber](/wiki/Stanley_Weber "Stanley Weber").[28] Gillan
told journalists that she was happy to be involved in a Scottish production
that "isn't about drug use or fighting the English".[29] The film premiered at
the [Edinburgh International Film
Festival](/wiki/Edinburgh_International_Film_Festival "Edinburgh International
Film Festival") in June 2013.[30][31][32] In 2012, Gillan appeared in the
television film _[We'll Take
Manhattan](/wiki/We%27ll_Take_Manhattan_\(2012_film\) "We'll Take Manhattan
\(2012 film\)")_ playing the part of supermodel [Jean
Shrimpton](/wiki/Jean_Shrimpton "Jean Shrimpton"), which told the story of
Shrimpton's relationship with the photographer [David
Bailey](/wiki/David_Bailey_\(photographer\) "David Bailey
\(photographer\)").[33]

Gillan starred in the lead role in the supernatural horror movie
_[Oculus](/wiki/Oculus_\(film\) "Oculus \(film\)")_ , which was filmed in
Alabama and released in April 2014.[34]

In May 2013, Gillan was cast as [Nebula](/wiki/Nebula_\(comics\) "Nebula
\(comics\)") in the Marvel superhero science fiction film _[Guardians of the
Galaxy](/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_\(film\) "Guardians of the Galaxy
\(film\)")_ , which was released in August 2014.[35] Gillan had her head
shaved bald for the role.

In May 2014, Gillan was cast in the [Ti West](/wiki/Ti_West "Ti
West")-directed Western film _[In a Valley of
Violence](/wiki/In_a_Valley_of_Violence "In a Valley of Violence")_ opposite
[John Travolta](/wiki/John_Travolta "John Travolta"), [Ethan
Hawke](/wiki/Ethan_Hawke "Ethan Hawke") and [Taissa
Farmiga](/wiki/Taissa_Farmiga "Taissa Farmiga"). Gillan portrayed Ellen, the
older sister to Farmiga's character.[36]

In 2015, Gillan appeared in the [Adam McKay](/wiki/Adam_McKay "Adam
McKay")-directed drama film _[The Big Short](/wiki/The_Big_Short_\(film\) "The
Big Short \(film\)")_ alongside [Brad Pitt](/wiki/Brad_Pitt "Brad Pitt"),
[Christian Bale](/wiki/Christian_Bale "Christian Bale"), [Ryan
Gosling](/wiki/Ryan_Gosling "Ryan Gosling"), [Steve Carell](/wiki/Steve_Carell
"Steve Carell") and [Melissa Leo](/wiki/Melissa_Leo "Melissa Leo").[37]

In 2017, Gillan reprised her role as Nebula in _[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol.
2](/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_Vol._2 "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2")_ ,
this time becoming a member of the film's eponymous team,[38] and co-starred
in _[The Circle](/wiki/The_Circle_\(2017_film\) "The Circle \(2017 film\)")_ ,
alongside [Emma Watson](/wiki/Emma_Watson "Emma Watson"), [Tom
Hanks](/wiki/Tom_Hanks "Tom Hanks"), and [John Boyega](/wiki/John_Boyega "John
Boyega"). The latter film, released in April, was directed and written by
[James Ponsoldt](/wiki/James_Ponsoldt "James Ponsoldt"), and was based on the
novel by [Dave Eggers](/wiki/Dave_Eggers "Dave Eggers").[39] Also that year,
Gillan played the lead female role in _[Jumanji: Welcome to the
Jungle](/wiki/Jumanji:_Welcome_to_the_Jungle "Jumanji: Welcome to the
Jungle")_ , a sequel to 1995 film _[Jumanji](/wiki/Jumanji "Jumanji")_ ,
starring alongside [Dwayne Johnson](/wiki/Dwayne_Johnson "Dwayne Johnson"),
[Kevin Hart](/wiki/Kevin_Hart "Kevin Hart"), [Jack Black](/wiki/Jack_Black
"Jack Black") and [Nick Jonas](/wiki/Nick_Jonas "Nick Jonas").[40]

Gillan reprised her Nebula character in _[Avengers: Infinity
War](/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War "Avengers: Infinity War")_ and [its
untitled, upcoming, sequel](/wiki/Untitled_Avengers_film "Untitled Avengers
film"), which were filmed back-to-back. [Principal
photography](/wiki/Principal_photography "Principal photography") began in
January 2017, at [Pinewood Atlanta
Studios](/wiki/Pinewood_Studios#Pinewood_Atlanta "Pinewood Studios") in
[Fayette County, Georgia](/wiki/Fayette_County,_Georgia "Fayette County,
Georgia").

###
Theatre[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Karen_Gillan&action=edit&section=5&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Theatre")]

In 2011, Gillan made her first theatre appearance playing the role of Shirley
in [John Osborne](/wiki/John_Osborne "John Osborne")'s play _[Inadmissible
Evidence](/wiki/Inadmissible_Evidence "Inadmissible Evidence")_ along with
[Douglas Hodge](/wiki/Douglas_Hodge "Douglas Hodge").[41] The play debuted at
the [Donmar Warehouse](/wiki/Donmar_Warehouse "Donmar Warehouse") on 16
October 2011.[41]

In November 2013, Gillan appeared on [Broadway](/wiki/Broadway_theatre
"Broadway theatre") in a play called _Time to Act_ , one of the plays included
in "The 24 Hour Plays on Broadway" to benefit the non-profit Urban Arts
Partnership.[42]

### Selected other
work[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Karen_Gillan&action=edit&section=6&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Selected other work")]

Gillan has also voiced advertisements for [eHarmony](/wiki/EHarmony
"EHarmony") and [The Royal Bank of Scotland](/wiki/The_Royal_Bank_of_Scotland
"The Royal Bank of Scotland"). Gillan also appeared in [TV on the
Radio](/wiki/TV_on_the_Radio "TV on the Radio")'s "[Happy
Idiot](/wiki/Happy_Idiot "Happy Idiot")" music video, released on 3 October
2014.[43]

Gillan wrote and directed her first short film, _Coward_ , which screened at
the 2015 [Edinburgh Film Festival](/wiki/Edinburgh_Film_Festival "Edinburgh
Film Festival"), and nominated for several awards.[44][45] Later in the year
she wrote, directed, and starred in another short film called
_Conventional_.[46]

On 2 November 2016, it was announced that Gillan will write, direct and star
in her feature directorial debut with Burbank-based development and production
company Mt. Hollywood Films' [indie](/wiki/Independent_film "Independent
film") [drama](/wiki/Drama_film "Drama film") project titled _Tupperware
Party_. Set in her home city of [Inverness](/wiki/Inverness "Inverness") in
the [Scottish Highlands](/wiki/Scottish_Highlands "Scottish Highlands"),
filming began in January 2017[47] and wrapped in the next month.[48] The title
of the film was later changed to _[The Party's Just
Beginning](/wiki/The_Party%27s_Just_Beginning "The Party's Just Beginning")_.

## Personal
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Karen_Gillan&action=edit&section=7&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Personal life")]

In 2011, Gillan helped promote Fashion Targets Breast Cancer (FTBC)[49] and
the opening of Squirrel Ward in [Great Ormond Street
Hospital](/wiki/Great_Ormond_Street_Hospital "Great Ormond Street Hospital")
in London.[50][51] During a 2012 interview on _[The Late Late
Show](/wiki/The_Late_Late_Show_\(CBS_TV_series\) "The Late Late Show \(CBS TV
series\)")_ , she stated that she had relocated to the US to star in the film
_[Oculus](/wiki/Oculus_\(film\) "Oculus \(film\)")_.[9]

She has stated that, although her family is [Catholic](/wiki/Catholic
"Catholic"), she has not been christened and is not religious, instead
agreeing with the statement that, "we're just minuscule dots in the vast
cosmic emptiness of the universe".[52]
